org.kepow.economysim

Class TransactionMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepow.economysim.TransactionMovement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerializable

    public class TransactionMovement
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerializable
    Convenience class that wraps around to doubles to represent transaction movement.
    Author:
    Thomas Churchman

        public void addMovement(double movement,
               Simulator.TransactionType type)
        Add transaction movement.
        Parameters:
        movement - The amount to add.
        type - The movement type (BUY/SELL).

      • decayBuyMovement

        public void decayBuyMovement(double decay)
        Decay buy movement by a factor. For example, if decay is 0.05, then 5% of the buy movement will be removed.
        Parameters:
        decay - The amount to decay with.

      • decaySaleMovement

        public void decaySaleMovement(double decay)
        Decay sale movement by a factor. For example, if decay is 0.05, then 5% of the sale movement will be removed.
        Parameters:
        decay - The amount to decay with.

      • getTransactionMovement

        public Tuple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> getTransactionMovement()
        Get the transaction movement.
        Returns:
        A tuple containing the buy movement as first element, and the sale movement as second element.
